title: Guitar maker Fender manipulated prices, competition watchdog claims
text:
Famed electric guitar maker Fender has been accused by the UK competition watchdog of rigging the market to make it more difficult for shoppers to find good deals online.

The firm fixed prices illegally by preventing online discounts on its guitars, the Competition and Markets Authority said on Tuesday.

From 2013-18, Fender Musical Instruments Europe demanded a minimum sales price from vendors, the watchdog said. This practice, known as resale price maintenance, is illegal because it means customers are less able to shop around for a better deal.

The retailer is one of the world’s biggest guitar makers, favoured by singers from Eric Clapton to Taylor Swift and bands including U2.
